16 February 2019
Friendly Newcastle United v CSKA Moscow Murcia

Martin Dubravka reveals what coaches told him after mistakes
When these kind of things happen, it’s very important to be honest, he told NUFC TV when asked about his rare mistakes against Manchester United and Spurs.

When I came into the dressing room, I told my team-mates ‘I’m sorry. I should have saved this of course.’ We lost some points but the great thing was that all of them supported me and the coaches they called me and said, ‘This can happen to the best players so don’t think about it too much. Forget this game and be ready for the next one.’ Which is a great attitude and I appreciate it.

This means we have quality people in the dressing room which were in the same situation I was after Tottenham and Man United so it’s important for me to have this great relationship with team-mates, with all the staff around, and this can help me in the future.

Manchester City have agreed to take part in this summer’s Asia Premier League trophy as they look to expand their international appeal.

The biennial tournament is being held in Shanghai this year, and comes at a time when reigning champions City have recently purchased a Chinese club, Sichuan Jiuniu.

They will compete in July against Wolves, West Ham and Newcastle for a trophy currently held by their title-race Liverpool, who won it in Hong Kong two years ago.

replies.msg:
The Ki and Jonjo Shelvey stats that cut to the heart of Rafa Benitez's big midfield decision
It’s largely assumed that Longstaff’s place will be taken by either Shelvey or Ki - given that a centre midfield with Diame and Hayden as the pairing would be too defensive.

Both Shelvey and Ki have clocked up a similar amount of minutes this season - Shelvey, 749, and Ki 845, but it is Ki who comes out on top for accuracy.

The South Korean has made 354 successful passes this season (85.7%) compared to Shelvey’s 334 (68.58%). Heading forward, Ki has once again shown his importance; 186 successful passes in the opposition half, with Shelvey complete 183. Interestingly, it is Mo Diame who comes out on top here with 229.

But when looking at those passes which were successful in the final third, the reason many are flying the flag for Shelvey’s return becomes clear - 112 successful passes compared to 94 for Ki, Diame’s 95, Longstaffs 57 and Hayden’s 72.

However, successful passes in the final third per 90 minutes puts Ki top of the list with 10.01, compared to Shelvey who lies only on 0.15 - emphasing the claims by some, that he isn’t accurate enough.

Of course, Shelvey’s ability means he’s always likely to create chances - and in just 11 games, has created 20 chances - six more than Ki, and 18 more than Diame.

Now then.

If you couldn't be bothered to scroll down to read the description of how Everton conceded the pen, then let us summarise.

Cross into the area
Jordan Pickford fails to catch the ball
Salomon Rondon is lurking behind
Salomon Rondon is hauled down by Pickford.
From the replay it looked as if Pickford made no attempt to retrieve the ball and instead chose to bring down the man.

By the letter of the law that is a red.

Players committing accidental fouls that deny a goalscoring chance will be cautioned.

Deliberate fouls will still incur a red card.

Those include holding, pulling or pushing, not playing the ball, serious foul play, violent conduct or deliberate handball in order to deny a goalscoring opportunity.
